intro: Aphragmus stewartii, commonly known as Stewart's aphragmus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
